stdout:
Your Red Hat Storage One Gluster deployment has completed
successfully as of Tue May  1 16:18:11 UTC 2018.

You may now manage your volumes using the gluster(8) command line interface.

Below is your default storage volume information:

====================
 
Volume Name: gluster1
Type: Distributed-Replicate
Volume ID: f1df155a-4133-416d-9d3a-78de8d533a10
Status: Started
Snapshot Count: 0
Number of Bricks: 2 x (2 + 1) = 6
Transport-type: tcp
Bricks:
Brick1: g1-1.example.com:/gluster/bricks/brick1/gluster1
Brick2: g1-2.example.com:/gluster/bricks/brick1/gluster1
Brick3: g1-3.example.com:/gluster/bricks/arbiter-brick1/gluster1 (arbiter)
Brick4: g1-3.example.com:/gluster/bricks/brick1/gluster1
Brick5: g1-4.example.com:/gluster/bricks/brick1/gluster1
Brick6: g1-2.example.com:/gluster/bricks/arbiter-brick1/gluster1 (arbiter)
Options Reconfigured:
ganesha.enable: on
client.event-threads: 4
cluster.lookup-optimize: True
server.event-threads: 4
network.inode-lru-limit: 50000
performa

nce.md-cache-timeout: 600
performance.cache-invalidation: True
performance.stat-prefetch: True
features.cache-invalidation-timeout: 600
features.cache-invalidation: on
transport.address-family: inet
nfs.disable: on
nfs-ganesha: enable
cluster.enable-shared-storage: enable
====================

Your volume has been configured for the NFS client.

The volume can be accessed via the virtual IP addresses (VIPs) configured
during the deployment:

10.11.12.6
10.11.12.7
10.11.12.8
10.11.12.9

These VIPs are part of a high-availability subsystem and will automatically
migrate between a subset of your Gluster nodes in the case of a node outage.

No load balancing for these VIPs is provided by Gluster. It is recommended
that you implement an external load balancer.


Example command for mounting your volume on a Linux system:

mount -t nfs 10.11.12.6:/gluster1 [mountpoint] -o _netdev


Example /etc/fstab entry for mounting your volume at boot time:

10.11.12.6:/gluster1    [mountpoint

]    nfs    _netdev  0 0


Your default volume has been configured on 4 out of your 4
total Gluster nodes.

Please see the documentation for instructions regarding the creation,
expansion, and deletion of Gluster volumes.
